comment: You can tell he's passionate about what he teaches, and it actually did make the lectures a little interesting. The reading assignments weren't hard, but do a little each week so they don't pile up later in the semester. Overall he was great!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I really enjoyed his class, attendance was not mandatory but he does do in class assignments here and there. All exams aren't on lockdown browser and he makes review sheets for every exam which is nice. Easy A, I'd recommend.
I really did enjoy this class, he is very nice and is not a tough grader. This is an easy A with a good professor and course. Definitely recommended.

Dr.Tillman is an amazing professor! Take him if you want an easy A. He gives out 3 tests and makes a review sheet that has the exact definitions you need to know! There is a meme assignment and a small essay, but both are easy 100's. He is willing to help you outside of class by hosting study sessions. He also has all of the power points uploaded.

3 exams with 40 questions and 5 bonus questions, he provides review sessions before the exam, and easy assignments are due toward the end of the semester. Lectures are typically boring, and students don't show up, but he is very nice and passionate about American Government. He made the course very easy and he responded to emails quickly. TAKE HIM.

Lectures were not great but he's very passionate and educated! Graded by 3 short essay assignments, but he's not a tough grader at all, and 3 tests. He does study groups before the test outside of class and creates study sheets. If you study them, you should be fine. Always open to questions. I recommend, he's very nice! POLS1101

There are three tests in his class, each with 40 multiple-choice questions and two required essays to be completed during testing time. 3 additional papers are assigned throughout the year. A lot of assignments each unit through the textbook. Lectures are all posted before the class but each lecture has a lot of information at a fast pace.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Test heavy

comment: he was kind of all over the place sometimes, but he meant well. not really a harsh grader, but the essays required a lot (10 pgs, lots of sources) so just be prepared to work.

He is such a funny professor who loves class engagement. The content can get pretty heavy in some units but overall, there is a good balance. Only like 2 big projects at the end and only 4 tests. Not a hard class at all and he makes it easy to apply.

Professor Tillman is phenomenal. I have never had a teacher who is as committed to their student's success as Professor Tillman is; he goes out of his way every day to help his students and comes to class with a smile on his face. it's obvious he enjoys teaching IF YOU ARE READING THIS SIGN UP FOR HIS CLASS BEFORE ITS TOO LATE.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class

comment: KNOWS WHAT HE IS TALKING ABOUT. WOULD TAKE HIM AGAIN.

Random unscheduled in class assignments for a grade so show up. Lots of online homework and quizzes due no lockdown. In person tests, go to his test reviews he tells you a lot of the test. There like 4 major papers you have the whole semester to do. Hes cool but I'm sure there's a easier government class out there. Good choice if you don't have any
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: He's very lenient with work and tests. He also did study sheets for all the exams which I thought was cool; everything he says would be on the test would. Sometimes I wouldn't show up and just studied the sheets and passed with A's. Class does get long + online work every week + group participation grades at the end but it's an easy course.

Attendance isn't mandatory BUT random class activities take place that will be due at the end for a grade. Not a hard class, but be prepare to stay on top of ALL assignments and notes, EASY to fall behind. 2 major assignments, weekly assignments and quizzes (15 questions) you can use the textbook. Studying is important for this course!!!
